page.title: 09SLUM CLEARANCE IN ELSWICK
page.content: Most of the area consists of 19th. century terraced houses and post war semi-detached council houses which have fallen into decay and are now being modernised by the council or are being bought by{private builders}who are almost rebuilding them and selling them to the general public. Large areas were cleared in the 1950's{slum clearance}programme and replaced with{multi-storey flats. Within about twenty years the area was in such a bad condition due to poor quality design and construction that the flats were vacated and eventually demolished. A more traditional type of housing development was planned for the area with terraced houses built around green open spaces.This new housing is improving the overall environment of an inner city area.
